did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: John D. Sharsmith Geomorphologic and Vegetational Time-Lapse Photography at Sand Creek, Albany County, Wyoming and Larimer County, Colorado Papers

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

did.abstract: Typescript masters thesis on photographic reoccupation of Sand Creek area to study geomorphic and vegetative change from 1897 to 1989.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Masters thesis study of geologic sites first photographed by Wilbur C. Knight, 1897-1902, then repeated by John D. Sharsmith, 1989, to document landscape changes at the various sites. Vegetative changes occurred, most often, at twice the rate of geomorphic and considered independent of geomorphic change.

Thesis manuscript contains chapter discussions on the nature of landscape photography, rephotographic process, geology, plant life and climate of Sand Creek area; an explanation, analysis and significance of the study; forty-seven matched pair photographs; eleven sites photo documented for possible change; photo negatives and site maps.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no other known archival collections created by John D. Sharsmith at the date of processing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Papers received from John D. Sharsmith in 1990.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by Rita Burleson in June 2004.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
